name: TheAtlantic
text: Many Americans are spending the final days of 2020 without the comfort of loved ones. Below are some ideas for helping navigate this lonely period. The latest Atlantic Daily, by @mimbsy: https://t.co/UstrD38RSt

name: TheAtlantic
text: Listen to @IsaacDovere talk with @WhipClyburn about the transition, Biden's cabinet, and the Democratic party in 2021. https://t.co/5XmNpshk58

name: TheAtlantic
text: Today, it’s easy to take Indian American success for granted, @arunNYC argues. ”What is forgotten is that before Indian Americans became a model minority, we were regarded as a problem minority.” https://t.co/0qYhEQsWp8

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @xtophercook: Me, in @TheAtlantic on the structural reasons why the UK (and Europe in general) reopened our schools, but the US didn’t https://t.co/0DpoJSno1J

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @prashantrao: Today, it’s easy to take Indian American success for granted, @arunNYC argues. ”What is forgotten is that before Indian Americans became a model minority, we were regarded as a problem minority.” https://t.co/DNjCKCTZT6

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @Saahil_Desai: This by @arunNYC is such a moving and insightful look at the Indian American urge to fit into white suburbia https://t.co/FI9uh1VgNq

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @prashantrao: “In Yang’s pages,” @BarbaraDemick writes, “Mao is a demented emperor, cackling madly at his own handiwork as rival militias—each claiming to be the faithful executors of Mao’s will, all largely pawns in the Beijing power struggle—slaughter one another.” https://t.co/A9ZScqBGJv

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @AdrienneLaF: “Vaccine providers need to set expectations for people getting the shots. If someone who gets a vaccine is unpleasantly surprised, they might not come back for a second dose or their experience might sway their friends and family against it.” https://t.co/xNQYs5icJz

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @anneapplebaum: "Rather than deter the Kremlin, the president has repeatedly refused to acknowledge previous Russian actions—basically giving Vladimir Putin an invitation to continue and amplify attacks" From @GrahamDavidA, on why the US has been hacked  https://t.co/IgUgjlTRUT

name: TheAtlantic
text: A 107-foot World War II–era tugboat has been abandoned in Alaskan waters for nearly a decade. Getting rid of it is easier said than done, @vgpetersen reports. https://t.co/UBsARmJKUh

name: TheAtlantic
text: Go ahead, take one: An ode to naps. https://t.co/1hEj8uUZDT

name: TheAtlantic
text: Netflix's "Ma Rainey’s Black Bottom" shows how the blueswoman kept the best of herself for the Black Americans who most understood the traumas sublimated into her music, Hannah Giorgis writes: https://t.co/PWRV4xoAz7

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @AdrienneLaF: "Dragging pandemic policy into the culture war has been a disaster for the country, particularly its children." https://t.co/xfm3bSOaJD

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @AdrienneLaF: Make art, read poems, play Scattergories. https://t.co/mzHk7LO6Dm

name: TheAtlantic
text:
RT @SStossel: "The good nap alights upon you like the grace of God: weightless, unmerited, spirit-altering. The bad nap, the sad nap, lies in wait like Wile E. Coyote with an anvil." 
(From James Parker's brilliant encomium to naps)

https://t.co/5dSYGICqcq

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @TheAtlPhoto: Day 19 of the 2020 Hubble Space Telescope Advent Calendar: Warped Space. This image of galaxy LRG-3-817 shows distortions due to gravitational lensing. This occurs when a massive object lies between Earth and a more distant object, warping space around it. https://t.co/oVvhgBoeYW https://t.co/gPRMVOO3pq

name: TheAtlantic
text: "The American death toll will rightly be cited as the main indictment of the U.S. government’s handling of the pandemic. But what has happened in schools is an astonishing public-policy failure of its own," @xtophercook writes: https://t.co/I8CumXukEe

name: TheAtlantic
text: "Trump’s failure to protect America has not yet received the attention it deserves," writes @GrahamDavidA: https://t.co/lQbJAs8JYT
